data.title: Great Late Lunch
data.text: We met some friends at this place and it brought back memories of when we all were in England.  I had pork chop with sautéed spinach and a garden salad with blue cheese crumbles dressing. Guys had the fish & chips and my gal pal had the lamb. Everything was selfish!  Service good. Place clean. Prices reasonable. The pale bear and wine was good, too! We four shares the bread pudding. It was pretty and tasted ok, but not as good expected. Tables spaced nicely and not too loud. Nice decor.

data.title: Good
data.text: We had a group of 6, 2 kids and a baby. The feed was good. The service wAs good. They have a nice neer selection. The fish and chips were a hit. They don't have much in the way of kids food, but that's ok, it's a pub.My kids ate chicken and fries and were hsppy.

data.title: Wonderful food
data.text: Our first time there the other night and we were so glad we went. Started with the cheese biscuit appetizer -yum! I had the fish and chips and my husband had the Abbey Cottage Pie (similar to a Shepards Pie). Both meals were very good. Had plenty to eat. Will definitely go back. Wait staff were very attentive. Prices reasonable.

data.title: English Pub Style
data.text: Friends recommended this place for dinner.  Atmosphere is very good, but food is just average.  I had the fish and chips, and having eaten fish and chips through out England it was just 'average'.  However, portion size was good and service was excellent.  I must commend this restaurant...at least they know the difference between cottage pie and shepherd's pie, which is rarely the case here in the States.  Good choice of beers.

data.title: Won't be returning
data.text: The Abby inn was on of my favorite stops for brunch. Unfortunately the last time that I was there.  I happened to have brought a few friends from out of state. We happened to stumble across a filming session and were told we'd be compensated for the hassle 15%. After enjoying our meals we received our check. Not only were we not compensated for the filmmakers overwhelming presence we were charged incorrect prices for our plates. When this was brought up to the waitress she gave an excuse about there still being old menus with out dated prices listed on them. They refused to even honor the price from the menus our orders were placed from. Very disappointed with the overall disregard for customer service.

owner_response.author: Tim T, Owner at Abbey Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Darrell,

My partners and I are sincerely confused.  We have no recollection of ANY authorized filming occurring in the Abbey in the past months, nor is it something we would likely allow during regular business hours.  If you could provide more details regarding the time and date you were in that would be appreciated.  As far as any discrepancies in the prices, our policy would absolutely be to honor whatever difference may have existed.  I sincerely apologize for the waitress's response.  

In any case, I would certainly appreciate the opportunity to discuss this matter further.  Please, email me at tim@theabbeyinndenton.com.  Thanks!  Tim Trawick
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friendly service food not so great
data.text: We came on a rainy day and were greeted by prompt and friendly staff.  I ordered the French Onion Soup which was watered down, and lacking in flavor.  My husband ordered another soup and had the same comment.  We think patrons would be better serviced to have one of the popular burgers we saw others enjoying.

data.title: Expected Better
data.text: It could have been the specific dinners that the 4 of us ordered, but we were not impressed with the preparation of the food. In particular, my wife did not care for the Fish and Chips. They appeared to have a great beer selection, but it seemed to be a bit pricey ($8.50 for the beer that I wanted).

data.title: Brit Pub Grub And More
data.text: The Abbey Inn Restaurant & Pub on Hickory Street in Denton is a great place to enjoy a pint of import, craft, or domestic beer and for a snack or meal in a pub atmosphere.  Serving lunch and dinner, they have pub grub favorites like shepherd's pie, bangers & mash, fish & chips, and a Scotch eggs appetizer.  They even have a real British Breakfast (fried everything). For those that don't crave British food there is a good selection of burgers and other entrees.  Great deserts too - the Car Bomb Sundae is so decadent I'm surprised it's still legal.  A great place for a casual meal or a pint on the Denton Courthouse Square.

data.title: Great food in a charming venue
data.text: A colleague and I ate one night and found it good. We went back the next night with two more colleagues who both pronounced it GREAT! Great service. Good drinks. Wonderful food. For starters try the Irish Soda Bread. The Scotch Eggs are unique and great too!

data.title: Food was just so so
data.text:
Our daughter and son-in-law recommended this place for Father's Day so we drove over an hour to eat here for lunch and were a bit disappointed. 

They highly recommended the fish and chips which was made with haddock instead of the usual cod. The half order was only one piece of large fish and wedge fries. The fish was so large that the batter fell off, and I felt it was overcooked because it was on the verge of being burned. I got a side of the potato crisps which are homemade potato chips and again, they tasted burned. 

My husband had the Churchill Steak Pasta which was grilled strips of NY strip steak tossed in a creamy Au Jus sauce on linguine. He said the steak was the only tasty thing in the dish. 

All in all, we weren't overly impressed with our food and won't be eating here again since there are so many other restaurants in Denton to try. On the bright side, there's a delicious ice cream cafe just down the sidewalk that is worth your time! 

There is also a free parking lot about a block east. It can be difficult to find parking.

data.title: English Pub in Texas
data.text: The Abbey Inn has gone to great effort to look like an English pub in downtown Denton, Texas. They offer British beers and food as well as some more common items. My favorites are the Cottage Pie and the Car Bomb - a delicious brownie sundae with Beth Marie's Guinness ice cream and a shot of Jameson's and Bailey's. OMG! Enough to share and sooooo good!

data.title: Great place
data.text: Staff was very friendly and the food was good.  Great atmosphere and a great place to meet up with friends and have a few drinks.

data.title: A solid "meh"
data.text:
Okay, we were there with a party of 8. The positives first: 1)decent beer selection on tap. 2) skilled and friendly wait staff. 

I had a reuben and cannot recommend it. It came out soggy. No one else at the table was a raving fan of their meals either. Other in the party didn't much care for their cocktail selections. 

This place would be okay to hang out and have a few, but I don't need to go there again.

data.title: Just awesome.
data.text: Visited this place yesterday.  The beer selection was fantastic, food was amazing, service was great.

data.title: Downtown Eats
data.text: Had shrimp taco lunch and were they good.  Very pleasantly suprised at a bar.  Right on historic downtown square.

data.title: Cool pub
data.text: The Abbey Inn is a cute little pub with good food, good drinks and a very professional and helpful bartender Lauren. Defiantly recommend if you are in Denton.

data.title: I Was Pleasantly Surprised
data.text:
Went to the AI today for lunch. Have to admit it was done kinda reluctantly on my part as I feared something over-hyped; long on contrived atmosphere and short on decent food. Happily i was wrong. Really wrong. I took the easy path and got a burger and fries. Both were absolutely outstanding. The burger had a nice char to it. Others in the party had shepherd's pie, lamb, etc and all expressed great satisfaction with their meals. 
Wife and I are going to put the AI on our regular dinner rotation. 
One thing to watch out for. They added an 18% gratuity (before tax) on the check then left a blank line for the tip amount on the credit card charge slip making it really easy to way over tip. Typically when I see this happen, the charge card slip lists "additional tip". Not so here. I'm not sure if this automatic tip was the result of our party being 9 in size or if it's done as a matter of course on all checks. I suppose I'll find out on the next visit. 
Recommended.

data.title: Great Mothers Day Brunch
data.text: Didn't know what to expect and went in looking for a reason to complain.  The atmosphere is English pub and the food was great. when in doubt or scared Fish and Chips work every time.  Large portions were served and our group was well pleased overall

owner_response.author: Tim T, Owner at Abbey Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi!  Thanks for the AWESOME feedback!  We hope to see you in again this Mother's Day.  Tim
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Pub
data.text: Went into Abbey's while passing through Denton with my boyfriend. Wanted a cold beer and a good meal and that's what we got. Great selection of beer, good pub food and a very cool atmosphere.

data.title: Burgers with new friends
data.text: This was a great place for a ladies night out, the ambiance was low-key but great for chatting and discussions.  The appetizers were delicious: soda biscuits, fried pickles, and calamari. There were many of us so I also ordered the burger and fries.  The burger was small but delicious and the cheese fries were delicious.  Oh, and the service was EXCELLENT, he was not only attentive but non-obtrusive and very considerate.
